title: Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description:
Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
Build 200110251.
OB: When the tab character is replaced with spaces in the first line, so that the two lines are visually indented the same way, and then ShiftLeft is executed, the text does not shift as expected. It is unclear from the specifications how this behavior should be, but in the first scenario, it appears that the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left, at least until the space character (i.e., the tab should be removed). In any case, it is confusing when there is a stray space, as it is unclear why the text does not shift.
EB: After replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces to visually indent the two lines the same way, executing ShiftLeft should shift the text as necessary. In the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left, at least until the space character (i.e., the tab should be removed). It is important to ensure that there are no stray spaces to prevent confusion about why the text does not shift.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces to visually indent the two lines the same way.
2. Execute ShiftLeft.
3. Verify that the second line is shifted left and the first line is shifted left, at least until the space character (i.e., the tab is removed).
4. Ensure that there are no stray spaces that could cause confusion about the text not shifting.
